poem:
Title: The Ascension of Man's Ambition

Up, ever up, man's grit dragged him,
Mallory, with cold-born purpose, Everest-bound.
The snow shrieked his name, in the icy hymn; 
His footprints in solitude, echoed around. 

Unseen summit, draped in fatal white,
A colossal deity, aloof, uncrowned.
The whisper of mortality in frost-gnawed night,
In icy veins, fear dared not resound. 

His ghost, in the windswept sanctum, lingers still,
A testament to the ceaseless, human will.
